intro: Veronica czerniakowskiana, commonly known as the Czerniakowski's speedwell, is a rare and endangered flowering plant native to Poland. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is a subject of conservation interest.
